params.text:
For conventional tillage, plow the field 2-3 times and harrow once to facilitate better construction of beds. Prepare pair raise beds at 20-30 cm high and 1 meter apart. Space between pair beds is 5-10 meters. Apply mixture of 1:1 ratio of organic fertilizer and carbonized rice hull (CRH) at the rate of 100 bags of 50 kg/bag and 1 ton/ha, respectively. Apply the synthetic organic fertilizer needed at a rate of two bags urea on one side each pair of bed parallel to each other prior to installing the plastic mulch. If there is financial constraint, rice straw or grasses is one mulching material that can be used. 

 

Zero tillage however can be done after rice. Spray pre-emergence herbicide to manage growth of weeds. After planting, rice straw is evenly laid on the soil surface at 2-3 cm thick.

The seeding rate for a hectare of land either direct seeding or transplanting is 2-3 kilogram of seeds. 

When growing seedlings:

  • Raise the seedlings in seedling trays. Use the mixture of 1:1:1 ratio of compost, sand and carbonized rice hull (CRH). 

  • Prior sowing, gently break the seed coat and soak in water for 24 hours. Incubate 24-48 hours until the radicle appears. This should also be done for direct seeding. 

  • Sow one seed in every cell of the seedling tray provided with soil medium. 

  • Water the newly sown seeds using fine nozzle sprinkler. Water the seedlings twice a day, early morning and between 4:00 and 5:00 in the afternoon. The frequency of irrigation is dependent on the crop growth.

In planting bitter gourd, it is recommended to: 

  • Transplant 2-3 weeks old or with 2-3 leaves seedlings on one side of the pair raised bed at 50-70 cm apart between plants along the row and one meter apart between pair row. 

  • Irrigate the plants by flooding or surface irrigation method between pair row while planting the seedlings to avoid transplanting shock. 

  • Transplant one seedling per hill. For crops grown without trellis, the same planting distance can be used.

Follow the same planting distance for direct seeding.

Staking is done in areas where trellis materials are not available.  When installing trellis, the procedure is as follows: 

  • Prior to installation of trellis, provide the plants with poles or stake for them to climb on the trellis. 

  • Install trellis 1.5 meters high above the ground.

  • Trellis can be made of wooden post, bamboo, and bamboo buho. 

  • Lay German wire or plastic straw horizontally on top of vines of the crop to creep on.

panels.title: Staking of Plants and Installation of Trellis
